entry.title: [Global][Dedicated Servers/VPS] - Rescue mode
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Dec 19, 09:00 - 10:45 UTC

Dec 15, 18:03 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 19/12/2022 09:00 UTC 
End time : 19/12/2022 10:45 UTC
Service impact : None
Service improvement : The objective of this maintenance is to remove options 'rescue64-pro' and 'rescue64-ovh' and replace them by 'rescue-customer' in 'Boot rescue mode' for dedicated and virtual private servers.
To use rescue mode, you can refer to the current link: https://docs.ovh.com/fr/dedicated/ovh-rescue/#en-pratique

entry.title: [US][Network] - Floating IP
entry.content:
Dec 15, 18:16 UTC
Update - The fix will be implemented tomorrow 16/12/2022 during the day.

Dec 15, 17:13 UTC
Identified - Start time : 15/12/2022 15:09 UTC 
Service impact : Customers that would like to add a floating IP to their network will take more time then usual to be implemented
Ongoing actions : Our teams have identified the cause of the incident and are currently preparing a fix

entry.title: [Global][Dedicated Servers] - vMac
entry.content:
Dec 15, 16:09 UTC
Resolved - Start Time : 01/12/2022 00:00 UTC
End Time : 15/12/2022 15:29 UTC
All EU, CA and today's morning vMacs have been restored unless if the client has created a new one in the meantime or if the IP is not on the same server as before the suppression.
Clients having vMacs older than 3 days until the 09/12/2022, can contact the support to be restored but their IP can't have a new vMac.

Dec 15, 14:41 UTC
Update - Our teams implemented a fix and are still working on restoring the vMacs lost today between 09:08 UTC and 10:55 UTC.
All vMacs lost during last 3 days reopening were restored.
The restoration of the vMacs in CA is estimated to be completed tomorrow evening(16/12/2022).

Dec 15, 11:14 UTC
Update - Our technical teams are always working on a fix.
Because our teams encountered problems while deploying the patch this morning.
Between 09:08 UTC and 10:55 UTC, IPs/blocks that were moved between two dedicated servers lost their vMac because the script did not create the tasks for the reaffiliation.
The vMac will be restored as soon as possible

Dec 15, 10:24 UTC
Update - Our technical teams are always working on a fix.

Our teams will restore vMac lost over the last 3 days, as well as vMac lost for more than 3 days reported by our support teams.

Dec 14, 16:19 UTC
Identified - Our technical teams are working on a fix for new cases. This fix will be deployed tomorrow. The vMacs will then be restored after renewal of the suspended IPs

In parallel, our teams are working on a tool to restore the vMacs lost over the last 7 days.
However, this tool will not allow to recover a vMac that you will have recreated in the meantime
We thank you for your understanding

Dec 14, 11:43 UTC
Investigating - Start time : 01/12/2022 00:00 UTC
Service impact : Customers might lose their vMac after they renew their unpaid additional IP subscription
Ongoing actions : Our teams are currently working to solve the issue
